uk.ac.ed.inf.powergrab

Interface Geography

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Charger, Drone, Position, Stateful, Stateless

    interface Geography
    Provides methods to get or calculate geographic information.

    Any class implemented this interface means its object has geographic information. Geographic information includes latitude, longitude, the distance to another object and the angle to another object.

    Since:
    0.3
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Tai Yintao s1891075@ed.ac.uk

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default double angle(Geography g)
      Calculate the angle to another geographic object.
      default double distance(double latitude, double longitude)
      Calculate the distance to a position with given latitude and longitude
      default double distance(Geography g)
      Calculate the distance to another geographic object.
      double latitude()
      Return the latitude of this geographic object.
      double longitude()
      Return the longitude of this geographic object.

    • Method Detail

      • latitude

        double latitude()
        Return the latitude of this geographic object.
        Returns:
        the latitude.

      • longitude

        double longitude()
        Return the longitude of this geographic object.
        Returns:
        the longitude.

      • distance

        default double distance(Geography g)
        Calculate the distance to another geographic object.

        The distance is the Pythagorean distance calculated from latitude and longitude. It's an approximated distance, assuming the earth as a plane and latitude and longitude are equally distributed.

        Parameters:
        g - the geographic object to calculate the distance of.
        Returns:
        the distance.

      • distance

        default double distance(double latitude,
                        double longitude)
        Calculate the distance to a position with given latitude and longitude

        The distance is the Pythagorean distance calculated from latitude and longitude. It's an approximated distance, assuming the earth as a plane and latitude and longitude are equally distributed.

        Parameters:
        latitude - the given latitude
        longitude - the given longitude
        Returns:
        the distance.

      • angle

        default double angle(Geography g)
        Calculate the angle to another geographic object.

        The angle from North to some compass point in clockwise direction, expressed in radinans.

        Parameters:
        g - the geographic object to calculate the angle of.
        Returns:
        the angle expressed in radians.s
